metadata.title: Organelle-tuning condition robustly fabricates energetic mitochondria for cartilage regeneration
metadata.abstract: Mitochondria are vital organelles whose impairment leads to numerous metabolic disorders. Mitochondrial transplantation serves as a promising clinical therapy. However, its widespread application is hindered by the limited availability of healthy mitochondria, with the dose required reaching up to 10 9 mitochondria per injection/patient. This necessitates sustainable and tractable approaches for producing high-quality human mitochondria. In this study, we demonstrated a highly efficient mitochondriaproducing strategy by manipulating mitobiogenesis and tuning organelle balance in human mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs). Utilizing an optimized culture medium (mito-condition) developed from our established formula, we achieved an 854-fold increase in mitochondria production compared to normal MSC culture within 15 days. These mitochondria were not only significantly expanded but also exhibited superior function both before and after isolation, with ATP production levels reaching 5.71 times that of normal mitochondria. Mechanistically, we revealed activation of the AMPK pathway and the establishment of a novel cellular state ideal for mitochondrial fabrication, characterized by enhanced proliferation and mitobiogenesis while suppressing other energy-consuming activities. Furthermore, the in vivo function of these mitochondria was validated in the mitotherapy in a mouse osteoarthritis model, resulting in significant cartilage regeneration over a 12-week period. Overall, this study presented a new strategy for the off-the-shelf fabrication of human mitochondria and provided insights into the molecular mechanisms governing organelle synthesis.

experimental_setup.description: Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) were cultured under standard conditions (tc-MSCs) or a specialized "mito-condition" medium (mc-MSCs) optimized for mitochondrial production. This mito-condition medium contained a specific combination of nine factors: basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF), sodium bicarbonate (NaHCO3), lipid concentrate, Insulin-Transferrin-Selenium (ITS), progesterone (Prog), hydrocortisone (Hc), Vitamin C (Vc), heparin sodium (HS), and human platelet lysate (HPL). The study involved comparing the characteristics of mc-MSCs and tc-MSCs, including cell proliferation, mitochondrial quantity and quality, gene expression, and functional assays. Isolated mitochondria from both culture conditions (tc-Mito and mc-Mito) were also compared. In vivo studies involved using a mouse osteoarthritis (OA) model, where mc-mitochondria and tc-mitochondria were injected into the joints to assess their therapeutic effects on cartilage regeneration. Various analytical techniques were employed, including high-resolution imaging, transmission electron microscopy (TEM), Seahorse extracellular flux analysis, ATP assays, JC-1 assay for mitochondrial membrane potential (MMP), reactive oxygen species (ROS) assay, flow cytometry, quantitative real-time PCR (RT-qPCR), bulk RNA sequencing (RNA-seq), Western blot analysis, cell scratch migration assay, cell adhesion assay, isolation of extracellular vesicles (EVs), micro-computed tomography (micro-CT), histological analysis (Safranin-O/Fast green staining), immunohistochemistry (IHC) for COL2 and ACAN, and bioluminescence imaging (BLI). Animal experiments were conducted following ethical approval and involved surgical induction of OA followed by intra-articular injections of mitochondria.

experimental_results.summary: A novel strategy for fabricating human mitochondria involves manipulating mitogenesis and organelle balance in human mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) using an optimized culture medium (mito-condition). This approach resulted in an 854-fold increase in mitochondria production within 15 days, with significantly enhanced mitochondrial function, including a 5.71-fold increase in ATP production compared to normal mitochondria. Mechanistically, the strategy activates the AMPK pathway and creates a cellular state favoring proliferation and mitogenesis while suppressing other energy-consuming activities. In vivo studies demonstrated the efficacy of these mitochondria in promoting cartilage regeneration in a mouse osteoarthritis model over 12 weeks.

quantitative_data_points.quantitative_data_point: 854-fold increase in mitochondria production within 15 days compared to normal MSC culture.
ATP production levels 5.71 times that of normal mitochondria.
mc-MSCs exhibited 2.83-fold increased amounts of mitochondria per cell on average compared to tc-MSCs.
mc-MSCs exhibited 1.70-fold increased mitochondrial proteins per cell on average compared to tc-MSCs.
mc-MSCs exhibited 8.69-fold increased mtDNA copies per cell on average compared to tc-MSCs.
Population doubling time (PDT) of mcMSCs was 21.23 h, compared to 38.45 h for tc-MSCs.
After 5 passages (~15 days), the total number of mc-MSCs was 302 times greater than that of tcMSCs.
Ki67 positive cells in mc-MSCs: 81.29% vs. 63.88% in tc-MSCs.
EdU positive cells in mc-MSCs: 30.20% vs. 8.24% in tc-MSCs.
EdU positive cells by flow cytometry in mc-MSCs: 28.35% vs. 7.86% in tc-MSCs.
Relative MitoTracker intensity in mc-MSCs at passage 5 was 1.23-fold higher compared to tc-MSCs.
Basal respiration levels in mc-MSCs were significantly increased.
ATP production levels in mc-MSCs were significantly increased.
Spare respiration capacity in mc-MSCs was significantly increased.
Total cellular ATP in mc-MSCs was higher compared to tc-MSCs.
Mitochondrial depolarization ratio in mc-MSCs was 4.32% vs. 10.41% in tc-MSCs.
ROS accumulation in mc-MSCs was 0.9 × 10^5 vs. 1.8 × 10^5 in tc-MSCs.
mc-mitochondria produced elevated levels of ATP post-isolation.
mc-mitochondria displayed higher MMP post-isolation.
9524 differentially expressed genes (mc-MSC/tc-MSCs, fold change ≥ 2).
AMPK pathway was significantly activated in mc-MSCs.
p-AMPK levels were elevated in mcMSCs.
TFAM was significantly up-regulated in mc-MSCs.
TOMM20 expression was elevated in mc-MSCs.
Reduction in lysosome quantity in mc-MSCs compared to tc-MSCs.
Reduced autophagy biomarkers (Beclin1 and LC3-II/I ratio) in mc-MSCs.
Attenuation of extracellular vesicle secretion in mc-MSCs.
Attenuation of cell migration in mc-MSCs.
Attenuation of cell adhesion in mc-MSCs.
Mitochondrial transplantation (10 μ g per injection, once a week) in a mouse OA model showed therapeutic effects.
mc-mitochondria group showed superior outcome in cartilage repair in 12-week samples.
Safranin-O staining showed a more intact cartilage surface in the mc-mitochondria group.
OARSI scoring evaluation indicated better cartilage preservation with mc-mitochondria treatment.
Immunostaining showed preserved expression of COL2 and ACAN with mc-mitochondria therapy.
Micro-CT analysis showed alleviation of subchondral bone sclerosis at 8 weeks with both mc-mitochondria and tc-mitochondria.
Only mc-mitochondria demonstrated the ability to reduce osteophyte formation at 8 weeks.
Cell viability measured using CCK-8 assay.
Cell cycle assay showed an increased S phase proportion in mcMSCs.
Alizarin red staining for osteogenic differentiation.
Alcian blue staining for chondrogenic differentiation.
Oil red staining for adipogenic differentiation.
Colony formation unit (CFU) assay showed more and larger colonies formed by mc-MSCs.
Isolated mitochondria transplanted to MSCs by coculture.
Isolated mitochondria transplanted to chondrocytes by centrifugation.
ATP concentration measured using enhanced ATP assay kit.
MMP measured using enhanced MMP assay kit with JC-1.
Total intracellular ROS levels detected by ROS assay kit.
Apoptosis of chondrocytes assessed using Annexin V-FITC apoptosis detection kit.
EVs quantification assessed with NanoSight NS500 system.
Micro-CT scanning of knee joint samples.
Bone volume (BV) of calci ed meniscus and synovium measured using Imalytics Preclinical software.
Trabecular separation (Tb.Sp) of subchondral bone measured using Imalytics Preclinical software.

qualitative_data_points.qualitative_data_point: Mitochondria in mc-MSCs predominantly exhibited a short and rounded morphology, in contrast to the elongated mitochondria in tc-MSCs.
TEM analyses confirmed the morphology features of mitochondria in mc-MSCs and tc-MSCs.
mc-MSCs had a reduced cell size, consistent with their robust proliferative phenotype.
mc-MSCs exhibited higher multi-lineage differentiation potential.
mc-MSCs consistently maintained a higher mitochondrial quantity than tc-MSCs across different passages.
mc-MSCs exhibited improved mitochondrial function.
The energetic mitochondria preserved their function during mitochondrial transplantation procedures.
The energetic mitochondria remained enhanced MMP after storage at 4°C or 37°C.
The function of mc-mitochondria stored at 4°C was more stable than those stored at 37°C.
Mc-mitochondria could boost both cell proliferation and ATP production in the recipient cells after transplantation.
Mc-MSCs showed distinct transcriptomic profiles compared to tc-MSCs.
Mc-MSCs were enriched for genes involved in mRNA splicing, DNA replication, cell division, ribosome biogenesis, and mitochondrial translation.
Tc-MSCs were enriched for terms including cell adhesion, extracellular matrix organization, cell migration, vesicle-mediated transport, and autophagy.
Mc-MSCs acquired a proliferative and metabolic phenotype compared to tc-MSCs.
Glycolysis was promoted in mc-MSCs.
AMPK pathway activation was confirmed by western blot.
mtDNA copy number and the expression of mitochondrial structural protein TOMM20 were elevated in mc-MSCs.
Treatment with AMPK inhibitor Compound C (CC) resulted in a significant reduction of total mitochondrial intensity in mc-MSCs.
Genes related to energy-consuming cellular activities, including lysosome digestion, cell migration, adhesion, and secretion, were inhibited under the mito-condition.
No evident changes in both the quantity and structure of the Golgi apparatus.
The quantity of the endoplasmic reticulum (ER) did not change significantly.
TEM indicated amelioration of ER swelling under the mito-condition.
Obvious reduction of lysosome quantity in mc-MSCs.
Autophagy biomarkers were significantly decreased in mc-MSCs, confirming a reduced level of autophagy.
Mc-MSCs demonstrated attenuation of other energy-consuming cellular activities.
Mito-condition was specialized to generate and reproduce mitochondria by restricting other unnecessary energy-consuming processes.
Mc-Mito transplantation effectively enhanced the expression of TFAM in chondrocytes.
Co-cultured mitochondria attached to the cartilage surface in a mouse cartilage explant model.
In vivo imaging revealed fluorescence diminished over time, suggesting mitochondria survival and function in vivo.
Mc-mitochondria exhibited advantages in mitochondria production and long-term cartilage surface protection.
Mc-MSCs showed robust proliferative phenotype.
Mc-MSCs showed stemness and low immunogenicity.
Mc-MSCs showed higher colony-forming efficiency.
Mc-MSCs expressed standard MSC surface markers.
Mc-MSCs exhibited improved mitochondrial function and robust energy supply.
Mc-Mito produced higher levels of ATP before and after isolation.
Mc-Mito demonstrated superior performance in assessments of mitochondrial membrane potential (MMP) and reactive oxygen species (ROS).
Mc-MSCs demonstrated superior performance in assessments of mitochondrial membrane potential (MMP) and reactive oxygen species (ROS).
Mc-MSCs showed increased expression levels of representative functional genes and proteins involved in oxidative phosphorylation (OXPHOS).
Mc-Mito demonstrated enhanced mitochondrial function in OA chondrocytes in vitro.
Mc-Mito transplantation reduced the rate of cellular apoptosis in OA chondrocytes.
Mc-mitochondria showed potential for rapid supply of high-functioning mitochondria for in vivo disease management.
The mito-condition promotes mitochondrial biogenesis by the AMPK pathway.
The mito-condition was specialized to generate and reproduce mitochondria by increasing the energy-generating process and restricting other unnecessary energy-consuming processes.
Mitochondrial transplantation could act as an effective intervention for OA.
Organelle-tuning strategy demonstrated robust mitochondrial production under customized condition.
The strategy provided new insights into the molecular regulation of intrinsic organelle biogenesis and energy balance.

data_availability.statement: All data and material in this study are available upon request.
